title: Cindy McCain to head U.N. World Food Program
description: U.S. Ambassador Cindy McCain on Thursday was appointed head of the U.N. World Food Program, the world’s largest humanitarian organization.

title: Gunmen threaten soccer star Messi, open fire on supermarket owned by family
description: Gunmen threatened Argentine soccer superstar Lionel Messi in a written message left Thursday when they opened fire at a supermarket owned by his in-laws in Argentina.

title: Sen. Welch urges Biden to take action amid West Bank violence in hand-delivered letter
description: Sen. Peter Welch called on President Joe Biden to help improve relations between the Israeli government and Palestinians amid recent West Bank violence.

title: U.K. spy chief 'profoundly sorry' for failing to stop Manchester concert bombing
description: The head of Britain’s security services said on Thursday he was profoundly sorry his spies had missed a “significant” opportunity to prevent a deadly 2017 suicide bombing at the end of an Ariana Grande pop concert in Manchester.

title: Greek rail workers strike over conditions after deadly train crash
description: Rescuers searched the wreckage of trains involved in a deadly collision that sent Greece into mourning and prompted strikes and protests over rail safety.

title: Bird flu cases in father and daughter in Cambodia came from poultry, not person-to-person spread, officials say
description: Cases of bird flu in two Cambodian family members, one fatal, show no sign of human-to-human transmission, allaying fears of a public health crisis.

title: Putin claims 'terrorist attack' near Ukrainian border; Kyiv denies involvement
description: Russia accused Ukrainian saboteurs of crossing its border and staging a “terrorist attack” in the Bryansk region Thursday, a claim denied by officials in Kyiv.

title: Blinken and Lavrov meet on G-20 sidelines in first meeting since Ukraine war began
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov met on the G-20 sidelines, the diplomats' first meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.

title: Scientists identify corridor in Great Pyramid of Giza using cosmic rays
description: A once-hidden corridor has been identified inside the Great Pyramid of Giza, after a yearslong project by scientists using cosmic rays.

title: Taiwan's military to get a $619 million U.S. arms boost as China keeps up pressure
description: The United States has approved the potential sale of $619 million in new weapons to Taiwan, including missiles for its F-16 fleet, as the island reported a second day of large-scale Chinese air force incursions nearby.

title: Situation ‘critical’: Ukraine clings to Bakhmut as Russians advance
description: Ukrainian forces hung onto their positions in the ruined eastern city of Bakhmut early on Thursday under constant attack from Russian troops seeking to claim their first major victory for more than half a year.

title: Remains of 2-month-old found in England after manhunt for mom, partner ends in arrests
description: British police found the remains of a 2-month-old baby Wednesday after officers arrested mother Constance Marten, 35, and Mark Gordon.

title: Dozens killed in train collision in Greece
description: After the deadliest train accident in Greece’s history, the country’s prime minister is blaming human error for the tragedy. NBC News’ Matt Bradley has the latest on the passenger train colliding head on with a freight train.
